intro: Xolisma formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan xolisma, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Xolisma formosana is often found in open woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
